Menag Sengaja Lempar Isu Cadar, PPP: Timbulkan Persepsi Liar
06 Nov 2019, 09:50 by Nur Azizah Rizki Astuti
Jakarta - Menteri Agama (Menag) Fachrul Razi sengaja melempar isu larangan cadar dan celana cingkrang untuk menjadi gaung bagi masyarakat. PPP menilai pernyataan itu telah menimbulkan kontroversi dan persepsi liar, apapun dalihnya.
"Apapun dalihnya, pernyataan beliau telah menimbulkan kontroversi sehingga menyebabkan persepsi yang liar. Seharusnya cukup saja dijelaskan bahwa ketentuan larangan cadar dan celana cingkrang berlaku di internal Kemenag yang khusus untuk ASN, karena ASN patuh pada aturan," kata Sekretaris F-PPP DPR Achmad Baidowi kepada wartawan, Rabu (6/11/2019).
Pria yang akrab disapa Awiek itu meminta persoalan isu cadar dan celana cingkrang ini menjadi pelajaran bagi pejabat negara dalam pola komunikasi publik. Menurutnya, pesan yang diterima lebih penting daripada kehebohan yang terjadi.
"Baguslah segera mengakhiri polemik di publik, dan ini menjadi perhatian ke depan terkait pola komunikasi pubik para pejabat untuk tidak memicu kontroversi. Yang terpenting adalah pesan tersampaikan, bukan menonjolkan kehebohan," tegasnya.
Sebelumnya, Menag Fachrul Razi mengatakan pernyataannya terkait cadar dan celana cingkrang yang akhirnya menjadi polemik di publik disampaikan agar menjadi gaung sebelum peraturan dikeluarkan ataupun agar masyarakat ingat peraturan-peraturan yang ada. Dia kemudian mengaitkan hak tersebut dengan peraturan berpakaian Pegawai Negeri Sipil (PNS) di instansi pemerintah.
"Semua PNS kembali kepada aturan menggunakan sesuai dengan aturan PNS misalnya. Teman-teman langsung bisa membaca, oh gaungnya sebelumnya sudah digaungkan. Mungkin juga berkaitan dengan celana gantung atau kaitan dengan nikab apa cadar dan sebagainya sehingga gaungnya sudah duluan kita buat sehingga pada saat muncul aturan mudah-mudahan orang tak berkejut lagi," kata Fachrul di The Sultan Hotel & Residence, Jalan Gatot Subroto, Gelora, Tanah Abang, Jakarta Pusat, Selasa (5/11).
Fachrul menekankan pernyataan-pernyataan kontroversial itu dibuatnya untuk sebagai pengingat awal. Dia meminta maaf bila pernyataannya memicu kontroversi. Demikian juga pernyataan soal radikalisme yang mengusung paham khilafah.

Minister of Religion Intentionally Throwing Veil Issues, PPP: Triggering Wild Perception
Nov 6, 2019, 09:50 by Nur Azizah Rizki Astuti
Jakarta - Minister of Religion (Menag) Fachrul Razi intentionally throws the issue of the ban on the veil and the trousers to become a reverberation for the people. PPP assesses that statement has caused controversy and wild perception, whatever the excuse.
"Whatever the excuse, his statement has caused controversy that causes wild perception. It should suffice to explain that the provisions on the prohibition of veils and circumferential pants apply internally to the Ministry of Religion specifically for ASN, because ASN complies with the rules," said DPR F-PPP Secretary Achmad Baidowi to reporters on Wednesday (11/06/2019).
The man who is familiarly called Awiek asked that the issue of the veil and trousers become a lesson for state officials in the pattern of public communication. According to him, the message received is more important than the excitement that occurs.
"It is good to immediately end the polemic in the public, and this is a concern for the future regarding public communication patterns of officials not to trigger controversy. The most important thing is the message delivered, not highlighting the excitement," he said.
Previously, Minister of Religion Fachrul Razi said his statement related to the veil and trousers which finally became polemic in the public was conveyed so that they would be reverberated before the regulations were issued or so that the public would remember the existing regulations. He then linked these rights to the dress code of Civil Servants (PNS) in government agencies.
"All civil servants return to the rules of using according to the rules of civil servants, for example. Friends can immediately read, oh the echo has previously been echoed. It may also be related to hanging pants or links with niqab what veils and so on so that the echo was made by us so that when it appeared rules, hopefully people will not be surprised anymore, "said Fachrul at The Sultan Hotel & Residence, Jalan Gatot Subroto, Gelora, Tanah Abang, Central Jakarta, Tuesday (11/5).
Fachrul stressed the controversial statements were made as an initial reminder. He apologized if his statement sparked controversy. Likewise, statements about radicalism that carry the understanding of the Khilafah.
